segments.text: Oh man, that sink overflowing is gross; water everywhere like a flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman drying the plate doesn't even glance down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot's in the puddle—yuck, that's going to be slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes stacked on the counter, probably getting wet too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the boy's on that stool, fishing for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's going to knock the whole jar over, what a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's just standing there, hand out like it's no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hate how the cabinets are getting soaked inside and out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window shows a pretty garden, but this kitchen's a swamp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If the stool tips, cookies and water will mix into slop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's in her apron, acting like nothing's wrong—infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene makes me want to clean it up myself.
segments.speaker: PAR
